intro: Cyrtandra kraenzlinii, commonly known as the Hainuwele plant, is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows up to 3 meters in height, characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant produces berries that are yellow when ripe, containing seeds that are dispersed by animals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
